section.title: Jmol Literature
section.p: A list of literature describing Jmol can be found at Jmol Wiki

section.title: Jmol Technical Notes
section.p: This document gives technical information about how Jmol is built, particularly with respect to graphics rendering.

section.title: Translating Jmol
section.p: Please, read instructions in this Wiki page and, if you need help, contact the developers team.

section.title: Scripting Documentation
section.p: This interactive online documentation is the reference guide for all commands that form the Jmol scripting language. In addition to an extensive description of all commands and options, it provides excellent demonstrations and examples.

section.title: Documentation for the JavaScript Library
section.p: Jmol.js (included in Jmol standard distribution) is a library written in JavaScript that can be used to simplify development of web pages that include the JmolApplet. Here is its description and documentation.

section.title: Scripting JmolApplet Without Using the JavaScript Library
section.p: This document explains how to write scripts to interact with the applet. Please, note that these methods do not use the JavaScript library, which is the currently recommended method to start scripting JmolApplet.

section.title: Documentation for Surfaces
section.p: This documentation describes and compares the different options available in Jmol scripts for generating surfaces, either based on the molecule or geometric. It also provides a testing and demonstration page.

section.title: Colors Used by Jmol
section.p: This document specifies which colors Jmol uses for elements, chains, chain direction, charge, hydrogen bonds, isosurfaces, positional variability, residues, nucleotides, and secondary structure. Also, it describes standard color names in JavaScript and the Netscape 8-bit color palette.

section.title: Atomic and Ionic Radii Used by Jmol
section.p: This document demonstrates, using a 3D periodic table, which radii Jmol uses for elements. Includes atomic, van der Waals and ionic radii.

section.title: The Jmol Developers Guide
section.p: The Jmol Developers Guide describes Jmol development procedures.

section.title: Official, but not up-to-date, documentation
section.p: These are official guides for Jmol. They cover the basic functionality of both application and applet, but they have not been updated recently (particularly, for features in version 11 of Jmol).

section.title: The Jmol Guide
section.p: The Jmol Guide describes the Jmol application.

section.title: The Jmol Applet Guide
section.p: The Jmol Applet Guide describes the Jmol applet.
